Edited March 23, 2019 by Gargamel
Large Font
Please refrain from using overly large fonts, it can make it hard to read on some platforms.   Thank you.
Go to Minmus in less than 20 parts. If that’s too easy, do it in less than 10 parts

Get to Moho with Kerbals (and back, obviously). I wouldn't call it easy, however your main concerns are only the transfer window, and heat. If you can land on say Duna, it's not that big of a step up, at least compared to other planets.

Rockets are easy. That's why I stopped making them. Their only use is to build stations and bases, maybe refueling imo. (Hm, ssto base builder?............)

 

Anyway, here is my challenge:

Build a rocket that is able to bring a rover to duna. The rover has to have the 2.5m science lab inkl. all the science gadgets and antenas to transmit science home (you may use the rocket as relay in orbit). The Rover has to be brought back to Kerbin afterwards.

Do an Apollo style Mun landing and Munar orbit rendezvous without using any reaction wheels. Disable any built-in reaction wheels in command pods and probe cores, too. It's not that much harder (you just need to remember to put some RCS ports on your vessels and bring enough monoprop), but it's more realistic. (Real-life reaction wheels aren't anything like the magic ones in KSP.)

If that seems too easy, don't use any RCS either. Use only engine gimbals for steering. Still quite doable, but needs a bit more piloting skill.

Spoiler

If that still seems too easy, disable gimbaling on all engines. You'll need to have multiple radial engines and toggle them on and off to steer.

If even that's not enough of a challenge, do it using solid rockets only. And still no reaction wheels or RCS.  (Yes, I believe it's still possible using boost flap tech. But definitely not easy.)
Do a challenge where you must send tourists to some destinations and back in the kerbin system and possibly other planets.
Survive an Interplanetary Re-entry with only one NERVA to resist heat, from Joolar orbit, or Dock with highly eccentric orbiting stuff without RCS or anything.
Crash 2 satellites together at 4000m/s

Easy: make a rocket powered aircraft

Medium: launch that rocket aircraft vertically from launchpad and land it horizontally on runway

Hard: fly that rocket aircraft beneath the skybridge on RnD complex...

Insane: ...And through the tunnel on RnD complex
